text.div:
NameCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Media ResourceA photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference
Frames can only be used for a photoWidth can only be used for a photo or videoHeight can only be used for a photo or videoLength can only be used for an audio or a video
type 1..1codephoto | video | audio
MediaType (Required)
subtype 0..1CodeableConceptThe type of acquisition equipment/process
MediaSubtype (Example)
identifier 0..*IdentifierIdentifier(s) for the image
dateTime 0..1dateTimeWhen the media was taken/recorded (end)
subject 0..1Patient | Practitioner | Group | Device | SpecimenWho/What this Media is a record of
operator 0..1PractitionerThe person who generated the image
view 0..1CodeableConceptImaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior
MediaView (Example)
deviceName 0..1stringName of the device/manufacturer
height 0..1integerHeight of the image in pixels(photo/video)
width 0..1integerWidth of the image in pixels (photo/video)
frames 0..1integerNumber of frames if > 1 (photo)
length 0..1integerLength in seconds (audio / video)
content 1..1AttachmentActual Media - reference or data

structure.purpose: This is the definition for the Media resource

definition.short: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference
definition.formal: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference.

constraint.name: Frames rule
constraint.human: Frames can only be used for a photo

constraint.name: Width rule
constraint.human: Width can only be used for a photo or video

constraint.name: Height rule
constraint.human: Height can only be used for a photo or video

constraint.name: Length rule
constraint.human: Length can only be used for an audio or a video

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.formal: Whether the media is a photo (still image), an audio recording, or a video recording.

binding.name: MediaType
binding.description: Whether the Media is a photo, video, or audio

definition.formal: Details of the type of the media - usually, how it was acquired (what type of device). If images sourced from a DICOM system, are wrapped in a Media resource, then this is the modality.

binding.name: MediaSubtype
binding.description: Detailed information about the type of the image - it's kind, purpose, or the kind of equipment used to generate it

definition.formal: Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of its collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers.
definition.comments: The identifier label and use can be used to determine what kind of identifier it is.

definition.formal: When the media was originally recorded. For video and audio, if the length of the recording is not insignificant, this is the end of the recording.
definition.comments: For an image including multiple frames, this is the start time.

definition.short: Who/What this Media is a record of
definition.formal: Who/What this Media is a record of.

definition.short: The person who generated the image
definition.formal: The person who administered the collection of the image.

definition.short: Imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior
definition.formal: The name of the imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).

binding.name: MediaView
binding.description: Imaging view (projection) used when collecting an image

definition.formal: The name of the device / manufacturer of the device  that was used to make the recording.

definition.short: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video)
definition.formal: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video).

definition.short: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)
definition.formal: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video).

The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single image, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this SHALL have a value in order to alert interface software that a multi-frame capable rendering widget is required.
The length of the recording in seconds - for audio and video.
The actual content of the media - inline or by direct reference to the media source file.
definition.comments: Recommended content types: image/jpeg, image/png, image/tiff, video/mpeg, audio/mp4, application/dicom. Application/dicom can contain the transfer syntax as a parameter.

definition.short: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference
definition.formal: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference.

constraint.name: Frames rule
constraint.human: Frames can only be used for a photo

constraint.name: Width rule
constraint.human: Width can only be used for a photo or video

constraint.name: Height rule
constraint.human: Height can only be used for a photo or video

constraint.name: Length rule
constraint.human: Length can only be used for an audio or a video

definition.short: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video)
definition.formal: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video).

definition.short: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)
definition.formal: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video).

The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single image, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this SHALL have a value in order to alert interface software that a multi-frame capable rendering widget is required.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: operator
searchParam.documentation: The person who generated the image

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Who/What this Media is a record of

searchParam.name: view
searchParam.documentation: Imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior
